body:
I'm not trying to be a bitch or anything but it's sad to see people go like so MANY people have gone this year and I know why either due to lack of interest, busy at school, can't be bothered etc. But it makes me sad because Avicus has had so many good people go and like I don't know where Avicus will be...

If anything, I'm probably worried about what will happen to Avicus seeing as basically everyone(not literally) are going. I guess I'm sad :(
I love this server too much but it's ironic due to my infractions xD. I guess I've just stuck around since mid 2013 and I don't want people to leave :/
body_tagged:

If anything, I'm probably worried about what will happen to Avicus seeing as basically everyone(not literally) are going. I guess I'm sad :(
I love this server too much but it's ironic due to my infractions xD. I guess I've just stuck around since mid 2013 and I don't want people to leave :/

replies.body:
I understand I mean I'm in my final year at secondary school but you see I've had minecraft for 4 years so that's basically since Year 7(Grade 6), and I have experienced good and bad things on servers etc and I have had probably a great time just playing Minecraft - but obviously I do other things outside of school Minecraft is just a hobby, and the amount of people that I've met is ridiculous. My dad always says to me you have to life with life son, it's just the way it is and although it can make me sad in a way it is the truth and sometimes the truth hurts but you have to accept it.

Anyway before I go onto a sob story, sr mods if you are reading this, I know you're trying your best with the server but you have to show it to us, make a change! Bring this server back like it did in 2013 when it was at its prime! :).





Or else everyone is just gonna go OCN :P

replies.body:
Most of the people who've left probably just got fed up with the idiots on the server. Some of the rules are pretty stupid and as people have said there's a lot of immature people on the server now. Kinda off-putting.

I already stopped playing Minecraft as a hobby. I only play it once in a while, and most of the time I just go on to talk to people. =P

Edit: Some of the players I know left because they don't like the changes being made to the server, myself included. A server is only as good as its content, and if the content is awful then there's no point in playing. =(

It's sad, but it's the truth. Life goes on, and those who do not follow the flow of time are left in the past, while others move on to the future,

replies.body: the server changed to much for me to the point that i dont want toplay anymore.
replies.body_tagged: the server changed to much for me to the point that i dont want toplay anymore.

replies.body:
Because of how repetitive Minecraft is in general, maybe it was more entertaining back in the days of survival servers but minigame servers like Avicus and OCN can definitely get more repetitive easier, especially now that there's significantly less players on.

Even moderating is repetitive, it may seem cool to hold a staff position and be able to ban hackers, but it gets annoying easily. It's no wonder why most staff who pass their junior mod trial don't even last more than 3 months, it's too much, and the impending risk of fucking up and getting demoted is also a factor. 

Sorry, but Avicus is doomed and there's nothing we or the staff team can do about it, maybe we lasted longer than TNT's thread said a while ago (Spring 2015) but no matter who our admins are or how many developers we have it doesn't matter. When the omega update came out earlier this year I thought it would save Avicus, simply because of how good of an update it was, I thought the quality of the server went way up. But did our player count increase? No, it went down, and is still falling. It's been a good run guys, but I doubt we'll still be here by the time this school year ends in May.
replies.body_tagged:
Because of how repetitive Minecraft is in general, maybe it was more entertaining back in the days of survival servers but minigame servers like Avicus and OCN can definitely get more repetitive easier, especially now that there's significantly less players on.

Even moderating is repetitive, it may seem cool to hold a staff position and be able to ban hackers, but it gets annoying easily. It's no wonder why most staff who pass their junior mod trial don't even last more than 3 months, it's too much, and the impending risk of fucking up and getting demoted is also a factor. 

Sorry, but Avicus is doomed and there's nothing we or the staff team can do about it, maybe we lasted longer than TNT's thread said a while ago (Spring 2015) but no matter who our admins are or how many developers we have it doesn't matter. When the omega update came out earlier this year I thought it would save Avicus, simply because of how good of an update it was, I thought the quality of the server went way up. But did our player count increase? No, it went down, and is still falling. It's been a good run guys, but I doubt we'll still be here by the time this school year ends in May.

replies.body: I agree with Nolan here. Minecraft does get repetitive and I am finding things a little boring now :/  I can easily see how people would quit, although I don't plan on leaving mc too soon
replies.body_tagged: I agree with Nolan here. Minecraft does get repetitive and I am finding things a little boring now :/  I can easily see how people would quit, although I don't plan on leaving mc too soon

replies.body:
I remember Avicus in 2013. One of the server's best years, in my opinion.

While I agree with a lot of the things that NolanDalton said, I don't think it's the game that gets boring. When I started playing Minecraft a few years back, I played almost every day. But as I got older, I began to realise that Minecraft just didn't interest me anymore.

It's not the game that's boring, it's the perception of the player that makes it seem boring.
replies.body_tagged:

replies.body: Maybe it's because...uhm... BLOCK LAG. If I'd have one wish for Avicus, it'd be fix block lag.
replies.body_tagged: Maybe it's because...uhm... BLOCK LAG. If I'd have one wish for Avicus, it'd be fix block lag.

replies.body: ^ tbh we can go around diagnosing the reason for the drop as being due to: staff, the tournament, the community. If we're honest with ourselves, the game-play OCN provides is much better due to a competitive environment, better maps, less lag, better hit detection and less bugs. The simple answer is most commonly the right one, people don't find the server or the games fun anymore.
replies.body_tagged: ^ tbh we can go around diagnosing the reason for the drop as being due to: staff, the tournament, the community. If we're honest with ourselves, the game-play OCN provides is much better due to a competitive environment, better maps, less lag, better hit detection and less bugs. The simple answer is most commonly the right one, people don't find the server or the games fun anymore.
